abstract: Banks in Florida are requesting that U.S. federal regulators exempt them from mandatory higher capital requirements because they are struggling to cope with the BP oil spill, The Wall Street Journal reported.
snippet: Banks in Florida are requesting that U.S. federal regulators exempt them from mandatory higher capital requirements because they are struggling to cope with the BP oil spill, The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: Banks in Florida are requesting that  federal regulators exempt them from mandatory higher capital requirements because they are struggling to cope with the BP oil spill, The Wall Street Journal reported.

headline.main: Florida Banks Said to Seek Reprieve From Capital Rules
